intro: Lessertia excisa, commonly known as the Natal mahogany, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, reddish-brown bark and long, pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by orange-red berries that contain flat, winged seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in coastal forests and riverine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
